articles.title: ECMAScript 5.1 Specification Now Officially Available in HTML

snippet.text: ES5.1 came out back in late 2010 and is now broadly (but not always entirely) supported by the latest browser versions. This new, official rendering of the spec in HTML gives us all an easier way to get up to speed with it

articles.title: Let's Code: Test-Driven Javascript by James Shore (on Kickstarter)

snippet.text: James Shore is raising $12k on Kickstarter to produce a screencast series digging into test driven development in JavaScript. He's only got a little way to go. More to this than I can explain, so check it out

articles.title: Async JavaScript by Trevor Burnham Now on Amazon (Print and Kindle)
Ember (JS Framework) Gets A Smart, New Homepage
CoffeeScript Enters GitHub's Top 10 Languages (Bumping Down Objective C)

snippet.text: Now I cross my fingers and hope Objective C didn't stage a coup in between writing this and sending the newsletter

articles.title: 10 Reasons Why I Switched to Spine.js

snippet.text: Alex MacCaw's spine.js is a popular choice in the JavaScript framework world and Jonnie Hallman has done a good job of rounding up why he prefers it to Backbone

articles.title: Self-Updating Scripts

snippet.text: Google's Steve Souders and Stoyan Stefanov wondered if there was a way to have longer cache times for third party scripts yet have resources update when necessary. They came up with a possible solution

articles.title: html5shiv and Loading Scripts From Code Repositories

snippet.text: Billy Hoffman demonstrates why loading scripts from sites that host code repositories (such as googlecode.com or direct from github.com) might not be such a great idea

articles.title: Notes From a TC39 Meeting (of May 22nd)

snippet.text: If TC39 meetings and the development of the ES6 spec interest you, David Herman has compiled together some notes. Topics covered include the handling of binary data and the implementation of classes

articles.title: List Of Languages That Compile to JS

snippet.text: Not a new resource but it continues to get updated and the sheer number of projects and languages that now compile down to JavaScript is impressive

articles.title: Interpreted Languages: Tcl, Lua, JavaScript and Io

snippet.text: A comparison table between four dynamic scripting languages including JavaScript. A handy reference or a way to get a feel for some unfamiliar languages

articles.title: Superscrollorama: jQuery Plugin for Scroll Animations

snippet.text: Like the idea of having elements animate, fade away, fly in, spin, slide and wipe as a user scrolls the page? Superscrollorama makes it easy. It's a big update from the earlier 'Scrollorama' by the same author

articles.title: Nodo: A Command-Line TODO App Using Node.js
Energize: Snappier Links on Touch Devices

snippet.text: Touch devices often introduce a delay when links are touched in order to catch other gestures, like zooming. Energize brings speedier 'clicking' to these environments

articles.title: Vertebrae: Front-End Framework with Backbone and RequireJS Using AMD

snippet.text: Vertebrae provides AMD structure and additional objects for extending Backbone.js as an application framework

articles.title: SpahQL: A Query Language for JavaScript Objects
Fibrous: Mix Asynchronous and Synchronous Programming Styles in Node.js

snippet.text: A node module that builds on node-fibers to provide a simple model for mixing asynchronous and synchronous programming styles in Node

articles.title: JSGL: Pure JS OpenGL 1.1 Implementation

snippet.text: JSGL is a software OpenGL 1.1 implementation written in pure JS built for use as the official graphics API on JSOS (a JavaScript operating system project

articles.title: Uptime: Open Source, Node + Mongo-Based Monitoring Utility
Kinesis: Build Gesture Driven Webapps with HTML, JS and Kinect
JavaScriptSQL: A Database Engine Coded Entirely in JavaScript
Johnny Five: Tools for Building Arduino Apps with JavaScript
Tuio.js: JavaScript Implementation of the TUIO Library

snippet.text: TUIO is an open framework that defines a common protocol and API for tangible multitouch surfaces. Tuio.js brings a port of the original Java TUIO library to JavaScript

articles.title: Promote A Job in JavaScript Weekly

snippet.text: Many people have asked if they can promote a job in JavaScript Weekly. Now you can with our new self service system. 20% off till the end of the weekend with code JOBLAUNCH. Any questions, just reply to this e-mail
